results.title: Report on Racial Bias in Baltimore Policing Also Exposes Gender Bias
results.abstract: Baltimore officers humiliated women who reported sexual assault, failed to gather basic evidence, and disregarded prostitutes’ complaints, the Justice Department found.
results.byline: By SHERYL GAY STOLBERG and JESS BIDGOOD

results.title: In Michigan, Hillary Clinton Calls Donald Trump Enemy of ‘the Little Guy’
results.abstract: Mrs. Clinton accused Mr. Trump of feigning support for working Americans, saying his tax proposals would “give trillions in tax breaks to people like himself.”
results.byline: By AMY CHOZICK and ALAN RAPPEPORT

results.title: How Much Does Donald Trump Pay in Taxes? It Could Be Zero
results.abstract: Mr. Trump has not released his tax returns, but tax experts say it is possible and legal that he pays little or nothing in federal income tax.

results.title: The Millions of Americans Donald Trump and Hillary Clinton Barely Mention: The Poor
results.abstract: While their economic platforms are markedly different, both candidates promise to create jobs but have said little about helping people while they are not working.

results.abstract: Greece is housing some 2,000 Afghan and other migrants in crumbling stadiums left over from the Games of 2004. The biggest complaint: boredom.

results.title: We’re So Confused: The Problems With Food and Exercise Studies
results.abstract: Among the drawbacks: poorly designed research, a variety of ways to measure and report outcomes, and a bias toward reporting “interesting” results.

results.title: The Superglue Diet: How to Make a Lighter, Fuel-Sipping Car
results.abstract: Carmakers are turning to airplane-quality glue for seams and thinner steel to trim weight, while looking ahead to using magnesium and coasting to save fuel.

results.title: Meet the Greenland Shark. It Could Be the Longest-Living Vertebrate.
results.abstract: Researchers used radiocarbon dating of the eye lenses of these lazy-looking predators to estimate that they have a life expectancy of at least 272 years.

results.title: With Congress Deadlocked, White House Diverts Funds to Fight Zika
results.abstract: The Obama administration said $81 million will be shifted to the development of a Zika vaccine, citing a failure by Congress to approve new funding.

results.title: Four Killed in Wave of Bombings in Thailand, Some at Tourist Sites
results.abstract: The stricken tourist sites included an area of bars and nightclubs popular with foreigners. A Thai official described a coordinated wave of attacks.
